form.official-title: To require the Postal Service to establish a website providing information on post offices experiencing emergency suspensions, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: Subchapter VII of chapter 36 of title 39, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

The Postal Service shall develop and maintain a publicly available website with an interactive web-tool that provides information about each covered post office, including the information described in subsection (b).
The information provided on the Website shall include—

paragraph.text: a list of each covered post office; and

subparagraph.text: the date on which the relevant emergency suspension for such covered post office took effect;
the reason for such emergency suspension;
alternative services available, including how to request curbside delivery;
the location of, and hours of operation for, the nearest facility providing retail access to postal services; and
to the extent practicable, the estimated date on which operations at such covered post office will resume.

subsection.text: The Website shall include functionality enabling a user to search for information about covered post offices by street address, ZIP Code, or post office box.
The information described in subsection (a) shall be provided on the Website—

subparagraph.text: presents such information on an interactive dashboard;
is searchable and may be sorted and filtered by the elements described in subsection (b)(2); and
to the extent practicable, enables any person or entity to download in bulk—

clause.text: the results of a search by the elements described in subsection (b)(2);

paragraph.text: in an open format that permits any individual or entity to reuse and analyze such information; and
in a structured data format, to the extent practicable.

subsection.text: Information provided on the Website shall not be considered as providing notice to any person that the operations of a post office have been temporarily suspended pursuant to subchapter 61 of the Postal Service Handbook PO–101, or any successor policy.

paragraph.text: The term covered post office means a post office at which operations have been temporarily suspended pursuant to subchapter 61 of the Postal Service Handbook PO–101, or any successor policy.
The term emergency suspension means the temporary suspension of operations at a post office pursuant to subchapter 61 of the Postal Service Handbook PO–101, or any successor policy.

The term post office means a Post Office, as such term is defined in section 241.1 of title 39, Code of Federal Regulations, or any successor regulation, and includes a post office branch or post office station.
The term Website means the website described in subsection (a).

subsection.text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Postal Service shall establish the website required under section 3692(a) of title 39, United States Code, as added by this Act.
